etymology.description: Pictogram – a plate, a flat dish; possibly a bucket. Later borrowed for abstract meanings; 盤 created for the original sense.
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicted a shallow vessel such as a dish or bucket. It was later loaned to express abstract ideas like “all, every” and “ordinary,” while 盤 took over the concrete ‘plate/dish’ meaning; traces of the vessel idea may echo in graphs like 同 and 筒.

examples.chinese: 凡是来的人都欢迎(凡是來的人都歡迎)。
examples.pinyin: Fán shì lái de rén dōu huānyíng.

examples.chinese: 凡事都有例外(凡事都有例外)。
凡人都会犯错(凡人都會犯錯)。
